fields.name: ARPANET-1
fields.description:
You are at the Network Measurement Center in the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA).

There is an SDS Sigma 7 computer here.

fields.name: ARPANET-2
fields.description:
You are at the Augmentation Research Center at Stanford Research Institute.

There is an SDS 940 computer here, named "Genie".

fields.name: ARPANET-3
fields.description:
You are at the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB), in the Culler-Fried Interactive Mathematics Center.

There is an IBM 360/75 computer here, running OS/MVT.
fields.command_description: There seems to be a glitch at a nearby port. Would you like to investigate the port?
fields.command_response: This portal leads to another server! It looks like it exits at Cornell. Type: go Cornell

fields.name: JVNC
fields.description:
This seems to be the John von Neumann Center at Princeton University. 

There's a PDP-11/73 minicomputer here.

fields.name: SDSC
fields.description: You've arrived at the San Diego Supercomputer Center at the University of California, San Diego.

fields.name: NCSA
fields.description: This is the National Center for Supercomputing Applications at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
fields.command_description: There's a book called "Hitchhiker's Guide to the Internet" written by Ed Krol here.
fields.command_response: This books seems to be a manual on how to use the internet! It tells you how to connect to the next server: go HelloWorld

fields.name: Cornell
fields.description: This is the Cornell University Theory Center

fields.name: PSC
fields.description: This is the Pittsburgh Supercomputer Center. There are accounts for Carnegie Mellon University, University of Pittsburgh, and Westinghouse Electric Company here.

fields.name: NCAR
fields.description: This is the National Center for Atmospheric Research

fields.name: HelloWorld
fields.description: Welcome to the World Wide Web. This will take awhile to load, so please come back later once I've populated the information.
